body: @jongyoul @zjffdu ping

Hi @prabhjyotsingh 
I merged your changes into my branch https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/compare/master...Reamer:selenium?diff=unified
and it is working now. https://travis-ci.org/github/Reamer/zeppelin/jobs/731234230

Because of the bugs in Firefox, I would switch to Chrome. In addition we are using chrome also for [`Run e2e tests in zeppelin-web`](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/2e69f712329ff0ce1af964df08c89328f0be84aa/.travis.yml#L71) and [`Run tests in zeppelin-web-angular`](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/2e69f712329ff0ce1af964df08c89328f0be84aa/.travis.yml#L102)

I will open PR.
Sure that sounds good.

Here's the Travis CI link: https://travis-ci.org/github/LeapYear/zeppelin-source

I've restarted a couple of failed jobs that look flaky - at least, I don't see any failures that look related to my changes.
Any more comment ? @Reamer
hi guys it would be great have feedback here!
LGTM, any more comment ? @jongyoul
@zjffdu I also approved it but I didn't set up merge-tool yet;;; Could you please merge it

> Any more comment ? @Reamer

No.
@jongyoul @zjffdu can you please tell me if this will be included in v `0.9.0`?
I think we should wait with this PR until after the release of 0.9.0.
LGTM
Will merge it if no more comment

Ping @zjffdu Any Ideas regarding https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3925#issuecomment-700567588

After some manual tests I found out that the communication with websequencediagrams.com was broken. I think because of 'https'. Therefore I decide to use `org.apache.httpcomponents:httpclient` for a clean API communication.
Now it's working
![Zeppelin_markdown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/454320/95192714-e3b8d580-07d2-11eb-969a-8c7ebb57867c.png)
If there are no further comments, I will merge this PR into Master and Branch-0.9 on Thursday (08.10.2020)
@conker84 Please update your PR discribtion and add a Travis-CI link.

I tested this manual and it seems to work.
+1 for merge
Please see alternative implementation in [https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3932](). This way we don't need to remove shortcircuiting paragraph status update in the browser.
Thanks for the PR, could you provide more details about how to reproduce this issue ? And it would be better to add unit test for it.

Default behavior: 0.9.0-preview2/spark-2.4.2/scala-2.12: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2196015/95227099-5ee7af00-0806-11eb-8f7e-b0493ccb59ba.png)

Fixed behavior: master + my fix/spark-2.4.2/scala-2.12:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2196015/95227208-80489b00-0806-11eb-8d40-685b0eee98bd.png)

> https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3932

@olkkoti Your link is wrong.

Could you add unit test here (just verify $intp is available is enough) ? so that we won't cause regression in future https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/spark/interpreter/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/spark/SparkInterpreterTest.java#L70

@PrarthiJain  can you fix https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-web/src/components/navbar/navbar.controller.js#L110 as well, right now it only refreshes when API returns a non-20x response.
I am closing this PR because it makes no sense to me.
Maybe it makes sense to split the PR into GSON update and knox support for Zeppelin client.

The documentation is wrong though:

> For now, there are two implementations: NullLifecycleManager and TimeoutLifecycleManager which is the default. 

I ended up here trying to figure out why it didn't work when I looked at the zeppelin-site.xml without syntax highlighting (I didn't notice that this section was commented out).

It would be nice if you could open a PR that would solve this documentation problem.
Your changes should be made in https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/docs/usage/interpreter/overview.md.
@Reamer gson upgrade is necessary to support knox. Let me create a PR for gson first.
Sure, here is a quick and dirty MR using GitHub's web editor: https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3962

I recently went through the effort to add Prometheus and Grafana based monitoring to a search stack for ecommerce applications, and what made the experience really great was that there was already a wonderful Solr template and Rails template dashboards available from Grafana.   Writing your own Grafana dashboard isn't for the faint of heart!  

Would you be able to publish a template dashboard for Zeppelin as well?   That would move this from a "hey, we *should* monitor Zeppelin" to a "no excuses, its easy to monitor Zeppelin" ;-)


https://github.com/querqy/chorus/pull/23

I know this has nothing to do with your change, but the HiveMonitor thread seems to run forever after the start. It also seems that one thread is created per statement.
Is that right?
